intro: Tragopogon kurdicus, commonly known as the Kurdish goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, which are typically visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and often branched. Tragopogon kurdicus is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience in harsh conditions.
